alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Durham; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 6:33PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Wake, southern Durham and northeastern Chatham Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 632 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Chapel Hill, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, cloud to ground lightning, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Durham, Cary, RDU International, Morrisville, Crosswinds Boating Center, Crosswinds Campground, Parkwood, William B Umstead State Park and Jordan Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
